meanings.definition: Eager or quick to argue or fight
meanings.sent1: The truculent cat hissed at anyone who came near.
meanings.sent2: She had a truculent attitude whenever someone disagreed with her.
meanings.sent3: The truculent squirrel challenged all the other animals to a race.
meanings.sent4: His truculent behavior in the game made him a formidable opponent.
meanings.sent5: The truculent storm clouds gathered ominously in the sky.

meanings.sent1: The truculent dictator ruled with an iron fist.
meanings.sent2: The truculent wolf bared its teeth in a threatening manner.
meanings.sent3: The truculent toddler refused to share his toys with anyone.
meanings.sent4: Her truculent words cut deep into his heart.
meanings.sent5: The truculent waves crashed violently against the shore.

meanings.definition: Showing a readiness to fight or be aggressive
meanings.sent1: The truculent wrestler entered the ring with a fierce look.
meanings.sent2: The truculent driver honked angrily at the slow-moving car.
meanings.sent3: The truculent chef demanded perfection from his kitchen staff.
meanings.sent4: His truculent response to criticism surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The truculent lion roared loudly to assert dominance.
